page.title: CPM Calculator - Calculate Cost Per Mille
page.description: Calculate Cost Per Mille (CPM) for your advertising campaigns with precision. Essential tool for digital marketers and advertisers.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Common questions about CPM calculations and digital advertising metrics

items.title: What is CPM in digital advertising?
items.description: CPM (Cost Per Mille) is the cost an advertiser pays for one thousand impressions on their advertisement. It's a standard metric used in digital advertising to measure the cost efficiency of campaigns.

items.title: How do you calculate CPM?
items.description: CPM is calculated by dividing the total advertising cost by the number of impressions, then multiplying by 1,000. Formula: CPM = (Total Cost / Impressions) Ã— 1,000

items.title: What's a good CPM rate?
items.description: A good CPM varies by industry, platform, and target audience. Generally, CPM rates between $1-$10 are considered reasonable, but premium placements or niche audiences may command higher rates.

items.title: Why is CPM important for advertisers?
items.description: CPM helps advertisers compare the cost efficiency of different advertising channels, optimize their media buying, and budget effectively for brand awareness campaigns.

items.title: What's the difference between CPM and CPC?
items.description: CPM charges for impressions (views), while CPC (Cost Per Click) charges for actual clicks. CPM is better for brand awareness, while CPC is better for performance-driven campaigns.

items.title: How can I improve my CPM rates?
items.description: Improve CPM by targeting more specific audiences, creating higher-quality ad content, choosing optimal ad placements, and testing different ad formats to increase engagement.
